author: Love Red

text:
Okay, after years of listening to this song, I have to get how much I love this song off of my chest.

It gives me freaking chills for how GORGEOUS it is. It knocks me off of my feet with the first freaking chord, and it just keeps building and building your anticipation. The vocals are so authoritative and powerful starting at :54; I cannot help but want to sing with them, and sing with FORCE, almost screaming, as if calling out to a vast army, stating that we will not fall; we will not stand down. The cadence of the syllables in this song just make my knees weak with sheer admiration and awe, and everything just EXPLODES at 3:12. The cadence of the lyrics....holy crap, I have never heard anything better. It holds that same authority, but amps it up to an 11, almost like that same army displaying their power through the complexity of their song. The words are said with such a staunch, almost immovable confidence, and the female vocals just emblazon that resolve, showing it for the power it truly has. FREAKING. LOVE IT. This is still a song that will bring tears to my eyes with how moved I am by it if I haven't listened to it in a good while. 

Thank you so much SupraDarky for sharing this song - it truly is an amazing, amazing piece. <3

author: Taislinmaosdela

text:
It's not about his 'style' or changing anything 'every' time as you have dramatic it. It's the point that every single thing he does looks almost exactly the same as his dragonball works. Not in style. In the literal sense. Go look at any half decent mangaka. Bleach or Naruto for example, while adhering to a single style, don't have the same exact face on every single character.

I do music. I don't make the same song every time, even though I have a certain 'style'.

text: I think it was meant to bring forth some nostalgia of past RPGs.
author: Jonathan

text: A little late, but this game is great. It doesn't really introduce anything new to the genre, but that's why I like it- It doesn't try to be revolutionary like most new RPG franchises do. My only real complaints are that it has bad voice acting (although you can switch to Japanese with subtitles) and it has a bad translation. Look past those two flaws and you'll find a surprisingly deep game.

text:

Blue Dragon is alot of things, but I don´t think it´s the best ;)
